page.title: 14Verulamium park St.Albans.
page.content: Verulamium was once marshy grazing land called{St Germains farm.}It was owned by{Lord Verulam}who{sold}it to the{council}for{Â£6500}in{1929.}The council got{government grants}to landscape it,as{75%}of the{workers} were{unemployed ex-servicemen}from places like Jarrow.Some still live in St.Albans.They dug out the lake by hand and uncovered some{Roman remains. Archeologist{Mortimer Wheeler} excavated others.The Roman walls, museum and hypocaust now{attract}many {tourists.}Over 1 million people visit Verulamium each year.On a fine{bank {holiday weekend}up to{8000}people come and luckily there is not much vandalism.There is{a cafe}and 3 lots of toilets.The{car park}only has 150 places so on a hot day all the local streets are crowded with cars.
